title: Meghan Trainor dazzles in a black gown trimmed in rhinestones alongside
text:
They got married in 2018 at their private home in Los Angeles.

But Meghan Trainor and husband Daryl Sabara got loved-up in public on Thursday as they got close for photos at City Of Hope's Spirit Of Life 2019 Gala in the Santa Monica neighborhood of Los Angeles.

The All About That Bass hitmaker, 25, donned a black gown with a belt and cuffs encrusted in glittering rhinestones.

Love: Meghan Trainor and husband Daryl Sabara got loved-up in public on Thursday as they got close for photos at City Of Hope's Spirit Of Life 2019 Gala in the Santa Monica neighborhood of Los Angeles

She accessorized with a fringed purse also encrusted in rhinestones and a pair of diamond drop earrings.

Trainor finished off her lids with dusting of sheer white shadow and a heaping helping of mascara.

Her husband added a pop of color to the grey carpet in a plum-colored suit, white shirt and black tie.

Chic: The All About That Bass hitmaker, 25, donned a black gown with a belt and cuffs encrusted in glittering rhinestones

Their appearance comes as Trainor admitted how many children she wants with Sabara to E!'s Daily Pop.

The singer told the outlet that she's looking forward to being able to 'travel the world' and 'make a bunch of babies' with Sabara.

And by 'a bunch,' she means three to be specific. 'I want triplets!' she said.

Glitzy: She accessorized with a fringed purse also encrusted in rhinestones and a pair of diamond drop earrings

'I want to get it all done at one time and be like, pop them in there. You know what I'm saying? Let's knock it out. Let's do it at once. You and me. I want twins or triplets. I want a doctor to put them in, you know?'

The two were wed in an intimate ceremony at their Los Angeles home in December 2018.

Trainor gushed to People to confirm their union, saying: 'It’s the beginning of an awesome, whole new life. I got way more than I ever wished for.'

The two first met in 2014 and they were engaged by 2017.

Songstresses Alicia Keys and Sara Bareilles were also in attendance for the glitzy shindig.

Regal: Keys wore a silk long-sleeved top with white pants that featured a cascading layer of fabric over them

Keys wore a silk long-sleeved top with white pants that featured a cascading layer of fabric over them.

She carried an ornate black clutch in her hands as she walked the grey carpet.

The singer performed with Bareilles, belting out a mash-up of Keys' Girl on Fire and Bareilles' Brave.

Bareilles wore a black collared shirtdress trimmed with gold accents that included a belt.

She also wore an oversize fedora and white studded boots to create a cowgirl-esque look.
